intro: Astroloba tenax var. tenax, commonly known as the starry bulbous plant, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its compact, bulbous base and clusters of narrow, grass-like leaves. During the growing season, it produces striking clusters of star-shaped, tubular flowers in shades of purple or pink. It is a drought-tolerant species, making it well-suited for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
